title: Having a global allows for better DRYness, you need only put values that are different into AssemblyInfo.cs for projects that have variance. This use assumes your product has more than one visual studio project.

inline_content.Text: Having a global allows for better DRYness, you need only put values that are different into AssemblyInfo.cs for projects that have variance. This use assumes your product has more than one visual studio project.

title:
//then the following might be put into a separate Assembly file per project, e.g.
[assembly: AssemblyTitle("Stackoveflow.Redis")]

title: Select Add/Existing Item… in the context menu of the project

inline_content.Text: Select Add/Existing Item… in the context menu of the project

title: Expand the Add-Button by clicking on that little down-arrow on the right hand

inline_content.Text: Expand the Add-Button by clicking on that little down-arrow on the right hand

title: Select “Add As Link” in the buttons drop down list
